text: [Music]
the next important technique to use is
finger style there are so many different
situations where I have to play finger
style in my professional life gigging
there might be a situation where uh
you're accompanying a vocalist and you
have to play something with arpeggios
it's much easier for me to use finger
style in this situation or a solo guitar
performance where I have to play for a
while just playing solo guitar often
times playing fingers style is very
useful for me in this situation so let
me give you some ideas about how to get
better with finger style uh the first
thing you want to think about when
you're playing finger style is the basic
idea that when you put your fingers down
onto the notes that you're about to play
that you plant your fingers they're not
going to be hanging over the guitar like
this they're going to be planted in the
place that you want to play uh you're
preparing for each note so one thing I
like to do is take for example a major
7even chord and play it as a chord try
to play all the notes
evenly and then try to
arpeggiate okay but once I'm done
arpeggiating four notes I plant
so plant the
[Music]
fingers I'll go up some
chords
plant
now you will not always be doing this
when you're performing but I find when I
practice with this planting technique it
gets my fingers used to where they are
going if they're always floating above
the strings I find that you will have a
lot of inaccuracies with where your your
fingers hit the strings so this is a
great way to teach your fingers where
they're going and then eventually you
can you can deviate from that a little
little bit here and there but it's a
great place to start even if you are
pegging like
this every time I come around to the
bottom I plant again
[Music]
watch this simple exercise is great for
developing control and
[Music]
accuracy another great exercise for
finger style is to learn how to control
the Dynamics of each note sometimes you
may want to bring out one of the notes
in a chord make it louder and you have
to develop the control with your fing
fingers in order to do that so here's a
great way to work on that I'll take a
chord say A D major 7
chord what I do is I try to play the
chord over and over again to achieve an
even
sound the next thing that I do is I try
to direct my attention to each of the
different fingers right now I'm going to
try to make the top note louder than the
rest of the
notes
here it is
even here's with the top note
louder now I will try to direct my
attention to the middle
note and now the first
finger and the base
note then I will try an exercise of
doing each one of them
[Music]
individually this is a bit of an
advanced topic but I think it's
something to strive for at the beginning
you might not be able to do this as you
develop make it uh a priority to learn
how to adjust the Dynamics between all
of the notes in the chord eventually
this will lead to more accurate and more
Dynamic

playing
